rules: Rule1: If device1 passes the quality check at qc_lab1, then device1 is calibrated.
Rule2: Device1 passes the quality check at qc_lab1 or device1 passes the functional test test1.
Rule3: Whenever device1 passes the functional test test1, then either it is sterile or it is not compatible with compound1.
Rule4: Either device1 has a maintenance log log1, or if device1 is calibrated, then either it is sterile or it is not compatible with compound1.
Rule5: Provided that drug1 is in production on line1, then if factory1 produces drug1, drug1 is successful.
Rule6: If drug1 is in development in lab1, then whenever factory1 produces drug1, drug1 is successful.
Rule7: Under the condition that drug1 requires approval from committee1, then either drug1 is in production on line1 or drug1 is in development in lab1.
Rule8: If drug1 requires approval from the FDA, then drug1 is in production on line1 or drug1 is in development in lab1.

Rule9: Provided that drug1 treats disease1, then if it is not the case that drug1 requires approval from committee1 or requires approval from the FDA, then drug1 is not available on the market at pharmacy1.
Rule10: If drug1 is prescribed for disease1, then if drug1 is not successful, drug1 is recalled by the FDA.
Rule11: Either company1 holds the patent for drug1, or if drug1 is not prescribed for disease1, then drug1 is not contraindicated for condition1.
Rule12: Under the condition that drug1 contains compound1, then device1 is used in the manufacturing of drug1.
Rule13: Drug1 contains alternative1 or, if device1 requires the material compound1, then drug1 contains compound1.
Rule14: If drug1 is expired, then drug1 is effective.
Rule15: Either drug1 is expired, or if drug1 causes a side effect in patient1, then drug1 is not safe for patient1.
Rule16: Provided that drug1 is recalled by manufacturer1, then drug1 is safe for use.
Rule17: If drug1 is recalled by manufacturer1, then drug1 is not safe for use.
Rule18: Drug1 is recalled by manufacturer1 or, if drug1 is expired, then drug1 is not effective.
Rule19: Under the condition that drug1 contains active1, then device1 is used in the manufacturing of drug1.
Rule20: Drug1 contains placebo1 or, if device1 requires the material compound1, then drug1 contains active1.
Rule21: If drug1 is contaminated, then drug1 passes the efficacy test.
Rule22: Under the condition that drug1 is contaminated, then drug1 does not pass the purity test.
Rule23: If drug1 passes the safety test, then drug1 passes the purity test.
Rule24: If device1 is used in the manufacturing of drug1, then device1 is not approved for production at factory1.
Rule25: Provided that device1 is validated by protocol1, then either device1 is sterilized by process1, or device1 is sterile, or device1 is not compatible with compound1.
Rule26: If device1 is operational, then either device1 is calibrated recently on date1 or device1 is validated by protocol1.
Rule27: Under the condition that device1 is in use on line1, then device1 is operational.
Rule28: Device1 is in use on line1 or device1 is in standby on line1.
Rule29: Provided that device1 is ready for use, then device1 is operational.
Rule30: If device1 is functional, then device1 does not require repair.
Rule31: Provided that drug1 is recommended for disease1, then drug1 is not contraindicated for condition1.
Rule32: If drug1 passes clinical trial trial1, then whenever drug1 is approved for condition disease1, drug1 is recommended for disease1.
Rule33: Under the condition that drug1 is regulatory approved by agency1, then drug1 passes clinical trial trial1.

Rule34: Provided that drug1 meets the guidelines of the WHO, then if it is not the case that whenever drug1 is not regulatory approved by agency1, drug1 is market ready, then drug1 is not available by prescription.
Rule35: Drug1 meets the guidelines of the WHO or drug1 meets the guidelines of the EMA.

Rule36: If drug1 meets the guidelines of the EMA, then provided that it is not the case that if drug1 is not regulatory approved by agency1, drug1 is market ready, then drug1 is not available by prescription.
Rule37: Under the condition that drug1 causes a side effect in patient1, then drug1 is safe for patient1.
Rule38: If drug1 causes a side effect in patient1, then drug1 is approved for human use by the FDA.
Rule39: If drug1 causes a side effect in patient1, then drug1 is not approved for human use by the FDA.
Rule40: Under the condition that device1 is compatible with compound1, then drug1 is contaminated.
Rule41: Either device1 is compatible with compound1, or it is not the case that device1 meets the specifications of standards1.
Rule42: Provided that it is not the case that drug1 requires approval from committee1 or requires approval from the FDA, then drug1 is available on the market at pharmacy1.

Rule43: If it is not the case that if drug1 batch batch1 is tested, then whenever drug1 batch batch1 is approved, drug1 passes the efficacy test implying it passes the safety test, then drug1 batch batch1 is rejected.
Rule44: Given that it is not the case that if device1 is in standby on line1, then device1 is ready for use, then device1 requires repair.
Rule45: Under the condition that it is not the case that if device1 requires the material compound1, then device1 is used in the manufacturing of drug1, then drug1 causes a side effect in patient1.

Rule46: If it is not the case that whenever it is not the case that drug1 is not successful, then device1 has an adverse effect on patient1, then it is not the case that device1 passes regulatory approval by the FDA, then device1 is approved for production at factory1.

Rule47: Under the condition that it is not the case that if it is not the case that drug1 is not successful, then device1 has an adverse effect on patient1, then it is not the case that device1 passes regulatory approval by the FDA, then device1 requires the material compound1.
Rule48: Provided that it is not the case that if drug1 is not regulatory approved by agency1, then drug1 is market ready, then drug1 is available by prescription.
Rule49: Under the condition that it is not the case that if drug1 is not successful, then device1 has an adverse effect on patient1, then device1 passes regulatory approval by the FDA.
Rule50: If drug1 is not prescribed for disease1, then drug1 is contraindicated for condition1.
Rule51: Under the condition that drug1 is not prescribed for disease1, then drug1 is approved for condition disease1.
Rule52: Under the condition that drug1 is not regulatory approved by agency1, then drug1 is not market ready.
Rule53: If drug1 is not successful, then device1 meets the specifications of standards1.
Rule54: Under the condition that drug1 is not successful, then drug1 is not recalled by the FDA.
facts: Fact3: Drug1 batch batch1 is approved.
Fact4: Drug1 batch batch1 is tested.
Fact6: It is not the case that device1 has an adverse effect on patient1.
Fact8: Device1 does not have a maintenance log log1.
Fact9: Company1 does not hold the patent for drug1.
Fact10: Drug1 does not contain alternative1.
Fact11: Drug1 does not contain placebo1.
Fact12: Drug1 batch batch1 is not rejected.
Fact13: Device1 is not sterilized by process1.
Fact14: Device1 is not calibrated recently on date1.
